III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation At an unknown date, a youth pulled on a staff member's shirt and
the staff member responded by choking the youth. When other
staff approached, the staff member stopped choking the youth.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on December 18,
2024, and reported they had no additional information.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Administrator denied being aware of any incidents where Staff 1
or any other staff chocked Youth A. Administrator reported Youth
A frequently targets male staff when Youth A is upset and will
become physically assaultive toward the male staff. Administrator
stated she was not aware of an incident of Youth A pulling on Staff
1’s shirt.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth A described “playing around” with Staff 1 grabbing Staff 1’s
shift then Staff 1 grabbed Youth A by Youth A’s neck and told
Youth A not to grab his shirt again. Youth A denied anyone else
being around and stated it occurred outside on the side of the
building where there were no cameras. Youth A stated it
happened prior to Thanksgiving, and it was cold outside. Youth A
reported being out for a walk with Staff 1 because Youth A was
upset. Youth A reported this was the first and only time Staff 1 did
something like this to Youth A. Youth A denied having any
2

injuries. Youth A stated he told Staff 2 and Staff 3 about the
incident but did not tell Staff 2 and Staff 3 the day of the incident.
Youth A reported he has never seen Staff 1 grab any youth by the
youth’s neck.
It should be noted Youth A told on-call DHHS Worker 2 Staff 1
grabbed Youth A by Youth A’s neck in the game room were there
are no cameras. Notes from that interview are listed under
Documents Reviewed.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Supervisor described Staff 1 as the “least aggressive person” she
knows. Supervisor denied being aware of any incident of Staff 1
chocking Youth A or any youth. Supervisor stated there are
cameras in the video game room as well as the family game room
and outside the building that should cover most areas.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 reported when he arrived on shift yesterday, Youth A told Staff 1
he was going to “get him into trouble.” Staff 1 stated he does not
work on Youth A’s unit very often and did not recall ever being
alone with Youth A in a game room. Staff 1 described Youth A
assaulting mainly male staff where Youth A will run up to staff and
start assaulting staff for no reason. Staff 1 reported there was an
incident when Staff 1 was in the game room with Youth B
supervising a virtual parenting time about two weeks ago when
Youth A entered and started choking Staff 1. Staff 1 stated it was
completely unexpected as he was not even working on Youth A’s
unit. Staff 1 described moving backwards to make space and
moving his arms up in between Youth A’s hands to break Youth
A’s grip. Staff 1 reported there was a female staff present but
Staff 1 could not recall who the female staff was. Staff 1 stated he
left the game room and did not see Youth A until later when the
supervisor from Youth A’s unit told Staff 1 Youth A wanted to
apologize. Staff 1 reported he went to see Youth A, they shook
hands, Youth A apologized but then Youth A tried to choke Staff 1
again. Staff 1 stated a supervisor was present when Youth A tried
to chock Staff 1, but Staff 1 could not recall who the supervisor
was as the unit supervisors change frequently.
Staff 1 described Youth A slammed Staff 1 into the side of the
building outside leading to the picnic area one time when Staff 1
was following Youth A who had walked out of the building. Staff 1
stated the unit supervisor was present when this occurred but
3

could not recall who the supervisor at the time was. Staff 1
reported he believed this was the same week Youth A attempted
to choke Staff 1 in the game room. Staff 1 denied ever choking
Youth A at any time. Staff 1 stated he did not recall Youth A ever
grabbing Staff 1’s shirt but it could have occurred.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Case Manager denied having any information of Staff 1 choking
Youth A or any staff choking Youth A. Case Manager was able to
provide visitation logs for Youth B.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
2 denied ever seeing Staff 1 choke Youth A or be physically
aggressive toward Youth A. Staff 2 described Staff 1 being
smaller than Youth A and not working on Youth A’s unit very often.
Staff 2 stated there have not been any youth who have expressed
any concerns with Staff 1. Staff 2 reported he has witnessed
Youth A attack and try to choke Staff 1. Staff 2 stated Youth A
seems to target male staff and be physically aggressive for no
reason, often choking or trying to choke the male staff. Staff 2
denied Youth A ever telling Staff 2 that Staff 1 choked Youth A.
Staff 2 recalled an incident when Youth A attacked Staff 1 while
Staff 1 was with another youth in the family game room sometime
in early October. Staff 2 could not recall who the youth was. Staff
2 described Youth A as “tripping” all day and being upset. Staff 2
reported Youth A got into the family game room, was acting fine
but then for no reason went over to Staff 1 and tried to choke Staff
1. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 got up from his chair and walked out of
the family game room. Staff 2 reported at no time did Staff 1
touch Youth A during this incident.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 19, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth B denied Staff 1 being choked by Youth A during one of
Youth B’s virtual parenting times. Youth B stated he has virtual
parenting times in the game room. Youth B described one virtual
parenting time when Youth A walked into the game room, walked
up to Staff 1 and grabbed Staff 1’s shoulders. Youth B reported
Staff 1 was not choked by Youth A and there was no physical
altercation that took place. Youth B denied Staff 1 left the room or
said anything to Youth A. Youth B could not recall when this
occurred. Youth B denied ever seeing Staff 1 choke Youth A or
any other youth. Youth B described Staff 1 as “chill and not
4

angry.” Youth B stated Youth A gets “bored” and will attack staff
when he [Youth A] is bored.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on January 14, 2025.
Staff 3 described having a good relationship with Youth A. Staff 3
denied Youth A ever telling her Staff 1 choked him or expressing
any concerns regarding Staff 1. Staff 3 denied being aware of any
staff choking or hurting Youth A. Staff 3 stated Youth A often
attacks staff, especially male staff, and chokes them. Staff 3
reported there have not been any youth who have expressed
concerns to her about Staff 1.
Video Reviewed
Camera footage for the facility only goes back 30 days. Video
footage from 12/05/24, 11/26/24, and 11/21/24 (dates of Youth B’s
virtual parenting time) in the family game room as well as the
video game room from 2-10pm was reviewed with DHHS Worker
and Administrator on 12/19/24. There were not any times Staff 1
and Youth A were in the family game room or video game room at
the same time. Youth B was also not seen in these rooms in the
videos. Video showed staff training on 12/5/24 and 11/21/24 in
the family game room so Youth B’s virtual parenting times would
have had to occur in a different location.
Videos were watched for the week prior to Thanksgiving. Video
showed on 11/20/24 Youth A was outside, upset, throwing an
umbrella and kicking a garbage can. Staff followed Youth A but
none of the staff involved were Staff 1. There was no physical
altercation between Youth A and any of the staff supervising
Youth A during this event.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident reports for Youth A dated 10/26/24, 10/26/24,
11/20/24 and 11/26/24. None of the incident reports
documented Youth A grabbing Staff 1’s shirt or Staff 1
being involved in any physical altercation with Youth A.
• DHHS Worker 2’s interview notes with Youth A dated
12/17/2024. “He [Youth A] stated that he feels threatened
by him [Staff 1] because he grabbed him by his neck. He
[Youth A] stated that [Staff 1] did this where there were no
cameras in the game room. He [Youth A] stated that he
does not remember why they were over in the game room
where there were no cameras. He [Youth A] stated that
[Staff 1] placed one hand around his neck and that it was
"sorta" hard to breathe. He [Youth A] stated that he never
lost consciousness. He [Youth A] stated that he does not
5

remember the day that it happened, but it was over a week
ago. He [Youth A] stated that it did not leave any marks or
bruises on him. He [Youth A] stated that he did not tell
anyone what happened. He [Youth A] stated that he did tell
[Staff 2] and he did nothing about it. He [Youth A] stated
that he also told [Staff 3]. He [Youth A] stated that it
happened in the right side of the game room and that [Staff
1] did it because he [Youth A] grabbed him [Staff 1] by his
shirt. He [Youth A] stated that while [Staff 1] was choking
him he told me [Youth A] to never touch him like that again.
He [Youth A] stated that he was just playing around with
[Staff 1] and that [Staff 1] did not know that he was playing
around. He [Youth A] stated that this was the first time this
happened.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 had one disciplinary action
dated 2/17/23 for engaging in a verbal power struggle with
a youth. Staff 1 had additional disciplinary actions not
related to care of youth. Staff 1 completed the required TCI
Behavioral Technique training on 11/26/2024.
• Visitation logs for Youth B for 12/05/24, 11/26/24, and
11/21/24. The logs do not document the staff members
name who supervised the virtual parenting times, just
documents “staff.” None of the log’s document the
parenting time being interrupted by Youth A.
• Staff 1’s schedule compared to Youth B’s virtual parenting
times. Staff 1 was in training on 12/5/24 and 11/21/25 at
the same time of Youth B’s virtual parenting time so could
not have supervised those two visits.
• Hurley Hospital exam for Youth A dated 12/18/24. Report
documents Youth A did not have any visible bruises,
scratches or other signs of physical abuse.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per Youth B and staff
interviews as well as video review no incidents of Staff 1 choking
Youth A were observed. Youth A was not consistent in stating
where in the facility Staff 1 choked Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to have the actual staff’s name
documented on the visitation log forms so who the staff is that
supervised the visit would be known.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
6

Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
